titleStmt.title: Edinburgh, 22. September, 1648. Whereas, many within this kingdom have joyned in armes for prosecuting of an unlawfull engagement against our neighbour nation of England, contrary to the Solemn League and Covenant, and treaties betwixt the kingdoms; the warnings and declarations of the commission of the General Assembly 1647. ...
titleStmt.author: Scotland. Parliament. Committee of Estates.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Evan Tyler, Printer to the Kings most excellent Majestie,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption and first lines of text.

A proclamation in two parts: one concerning the unlawfulness of breaking the peace with England; the other declaring that persons who are in arms against, or hostile towards, England should be barred from posts of high responsibility.
Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland.
